TEI.2.document_title: D T Fitchett to James F Perry, 09-22-1835

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 132-133

div1.p: Sir I left Columbia this morning and promised to send letters immediately from Col Austin to you. Which promise I have complied with also an express to the Mouth of the Brazes. I should like to see you here I expect that all the newes is in your letters if not come to town and we will give you all we no which cannot be doubted General Cos is on his March with 5000 soldiers and one-fourth tied with Roap to keep them from deserting this is fact which we cannot doubt—
[Addressed:] Mr. James F. Perry Peach Point
